definition: to practice/to train/to drill/to perfect (one's skill)/exercise/(literary) white silk/to boil and scour raw silk
camp/barracks/battalion/to build/to operate/to manage/to strive for

sentences.english: And he hasn't shot much in the scrimmages in this camp either.
sentences.chinese: 到训练营以来，他一直投得不多。

sentences.english: The national squad are holding training camp in Beijing to prepare for the Asian Championship.
sentences.chinese: 国家队为了备战亚锦赛，在北京举行训练营。

sentences.english: After the game the kopeck only said to him "our training battalion sees".
sentences.chinese: 赛后科比只跟他说了一句“我们训练营见”。

sentences.english: Stoudemire injured the same eye in training camp this season.
sentences.chinese: 小斯的眼睛在本赛季的季前的训练营就伤过。

sentences.english: M: Then you can go to the three-day-long training camp first.
sentences.chinese: 那么你可以先参见三天训练营。

sentences.english: I put myself through my own midseason training camp.
sentences.chinese: 我在赛季中把自己扔进了训练营。

sentences.english: The Paladin training camp is destroyed.
sentences.chinese: 圣骑士训练营地被摧毁。

sentences.english: The teenager died at an illegal boot camp for Internet addicts.
sentences.chinese: 这个孩子在一家非法“网瘾训练营”不幸身亡。

sentences.english: Consider having your own “mini-camp” in your homes.
sentences.chinese: 考虑在家里开个短期训练营。

sentences.english: How are you finding the early days in our pre-season training camp?
sentences.chinese: 在我们季前赛这几天训练营你的所得所获？

sentences.english: Hear that?We're heading to the Valkyrie training camp.
sentences.chinese: 听到了吗？我们要去瓦尔基理斯的训练营。

sentences.english: Think of it as a cabaret training camp in New Haven, Connecticut.
sentences.chinese: 可以将它视作康涅狄格纽黑文的一个歌厅歌手训练营。

sentences.english: The league plans a 66-game season and aims to open training camps 9th December.
sentences.chinese: 本赛季将由66场比赛，训练营将在12月9日开始。

sentences.english: Enroll in this boot camp to learn more.
sentences.chinese: 参加这个新手训练营，从而了解更多内容。

sentences.english: Diop views himself from the same prism as many of his campers.
sentences.chinese: 迪奥普认为自己就是许多训练营员的一面镜子。

sentences.english: Training camp, he said, will quickly ingrain those principles.
sentences.chinese: 他说训练营会很快让那些原则根深蒂固。

definition: to train together/to practice as a group
to compete/competition/match/to surpass/better than/superior to/to excel
to warm up (sports)/(fig.) to prepare/to get in condition
student/member of an institution of learning/officer cadet
football played with oval-shaped ball (rugby, American football, Australian rules etc)
